name: St. Anthony's Indoor Stadium
description: Soft material, has nice wide turns, even sprinting in the inner lanes is not that bad.

name: SCCC Exhibition and Sports Complex
description: Lovely track, nice mondo material, nice turns, seen some great races ran here, just jealous because I didn't get to compete on this track in highschool, the track became resurfaced after I graduated.

name: Lusk Field House
description: Man oh man...this place brings back memories, this is the indoor track at my alma mater SUNY Cortland, used to run at this track almost everyday when I was on their track team. It's a decent track, hard surface with good grip, great for the 55m and 60m races, however, the turns are extremely sharp, so good luck running on the turns here...yes, even in the outermost lane...

name: New Balance Armory
description: The famous Armory, home of all the best indoor track events in New York. I love this track, great material, nice banked turns, I really felt fast on this track, the only trouble was the lanes because they're very narrow, it's easy to run into someone else's lane.

name: Ocean Breeze Track Facility
description: The Armory's new contender, recently built a couple of years back in Central Park, it's starting to take over as the hotspot for indoor track and field in the NYC area. A beautiful facility with a track that has a soft, bouncy surface, nice turns, I can definitely see the hype.

name: BU Track and Tennis Center
description: The track used for the legendary David Hemery Valentine Invitational, very fast track with highly banked turns, a bouncy surface. A favorite for many 200m-1600m runners who utilize the fast turns.

name: Barton Hall Field House
description: The indoor track for the popular Ivy League University, recently resurfaced, beautiful new color, nice wide turns with nice grip, they did a great job with the resurfacing.

name: Special Events Recreational Center
description: This track breeds PR's, great mondo surface with nice turns, very fast track.

name: Glazer Area
description: A good-looking track, hard surface, turns aren't too bad, I heard it became resurfaced recently and I'd love to run on it again to try it out.

name: Reggie Lewis Center
description: I only ran here once, the banked turns are pretty low, so the turns arent too fast, other than that it feels nice to run on.
